tn.ref: If I have found favor in your eyes
tn.text: Here the eyes represent seeing, and seeing represents thoughts or judgment. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:20:03|20:3]]. AT: "If I have pleased you" or "If you consider me favorably" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: let them give me a place
tn.text: Since Achish was the one who would "give," this is a metonym for "please give me a place." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: one of the cities in the country
tn.text: "one of the outlying towns" or "one of the towns outside the city"

tn.ref: for why should your servant live in the royal city with you?
tn.text: This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "I do not need to live in the city with you." or "I am not important enough to live here with you in the royal city." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
